block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam counties this week. Items for the guide may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calender, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam counties this week. Items for the guide may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calender, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CHAPPAQUA -- Chappaqua Drama Group presents ''The Miracle Worker'' by William Gibson. Next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Through May 21. Tickets: $16; $14 for youths 13 through 18 and people 65 and older. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. 238-5003.
CROTON FALLS -- ''The Subject Was Roses'' by Frank Gilroy. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $17. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road; off Route 22 North. 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Grease.'' Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6 and Sundays at 7 p.m., with dinner at 5. Matinees: Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m., and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Through June 24. Tickets: $46 to $66, with discounts available at selected performances for children, students and older people. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. 592-2222.

HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- The musical revue ''The World Goes Round -- The Songs of Kander and Ebb,'' performed for local youngsters. Next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20; $10 for children and older people. Broadway Training Center of Westchester, 10 Washington Avenue. 478-5825.

IRVINGTON -- ''Children of Eden,'' a family musical by Stephen Schwartz. Presented by PMT Productions. Today at 2 p.m., Friday at 8 p.m. and next Saturday at 2 and 8 p.m. Tickets: $18; $15 for students through high school and people 65 and older. Irvington Town Hall Theater, 85 Main Street. 428-8446.

MOUNT VERNON -- ''Wine in the Wilderness'' by Alice Childress. Today at 3 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $8.50 for students and older people. Open Cage Theater, 326 South Third Avenue. 668-0814.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Premiere of Nelson Sheeley's '' . . . and call me in the morning.'' Today at 2 p.m., Wednesday and Thursday at 7:30 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25, with discounts for students and older people. Fleetwood Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. 654-8533.

PURCHASE -- ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' presented by the Play Group Theater for Children and Young Adults. Today and next Sunday at 1 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people; $10 for children. Little Theater of Manhattanville College. 946-0649.

YONKERS -- The musical ''The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas.'' Presented by Actors Conservatory Theater. (Not recommended for young children.) Friday at 8 p.m., next Saturday at 2 and 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Through May 21. Tickets: $16; matinee performances only, $14 for people 62 and older; advance tickets $1 less. Bryn Mawr Park Presbyterian Church, 20 Buckingham Road. 352-8307.
Music and Dance

BEDFORD -- Master Singers of Westchester, with Les Robinson Hadsell, director, featuring Handel's ''Coronation Anthems,'' Bach's ''Singet dem Herrn ein Neues Lied'' and Durante's ''Magnificat.'' Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students and older people. Bedford Presbyterian Church, Bedford Village Green. 234-6535.

BRONXVILLE -- Westchester Chorale, featuring Daniel Paget, conductor, joined by vocal soloists and orchestra. Schubert's ''Mass in A flat'' and Mendelssohn's Psalm 42 ''Wie der Hirsch Schreit.'' Today at 3 p.m. Sommer Center, Concordia College. 693-0990.
BRONXVILLE -- Recital by Robin Murphy, mezzo-soprano. Today at 3 p.m. Free. West Center Congregational Church, 101 Pondfield Road West. 337-3929.

BRONXVILLE -- Three for the Show, presenting excerpts from Verdi's ''Rigoletto,'' narrated by Lu Gmoser. Today at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for older people; free to students. Piero Bonaguri, guitarist, and other artists, featuring works by Paganini, Villa-Lobos and other composers. Next Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; $8 for students and older people. Both concerts sponsored by the Eastchester Arts Council. Bronxville Women's Club, 135 Midland Avenue. 793-6946.
BRONXVILLE -- Ronald Copes, violinist, and Seymour Lipkin, pianist. Today at 4 p.m. Free. Reformed Church of Bronxville, Pondfield Road at Midland Avenue. 337-6776.

NEW ROCHELLE -- New Rochelle Opera with Camille Coppola, director, performing ''I Pagliacci.'' Today at 3 and next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. 632-7878, ext. 33.

PURCHASE -- Alumni of the Yale Russian Chorus; Denis Michiewicz, director, featuring secular, religious, folk and soldiers' songs. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Recital hall of music building. (203) 637-4789. Greenleaf Chamber Players, featuring music by Saint-Saens, Faure, Poulenc and Ravel. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $28. A capella ensemble Sweet Honey in the Rock. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $30. ''Trumpet Fest! Louis Armstrong Centennial Celebration,'' with Jon Faddis, Clark Terry, Randy Brecker, Tyrell Stafford and others. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $30. Westchester Choral Society; Lyndon Woodside, music director, performing Orff's ''Carmina Burana'' and Mendelssohn's ''Hear My Prayer.''. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25; additional $5 for reception with refreshments after concert. Performing Arts Center. 251-6200. Purchase College.

SCARSDALE -- New Choral Society of Central Westchester; Dr. John T. King, conductor, joined by soloists and orchestra. Mendelssohn's ''Hear My Prayer'' and Haydn's ''Mass in B flat'' (''Harmoniemesse''). Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15 and $20; $12 for older people. Hitchcock Presbyterian Church, 6 Greenacres Avenue. 725-1678.

SCARSDALE -- ''Jazz Night'' with the Hoff-Barthelson Jazz Ensemble, student ensemble and soloists playing music by Duke Ellington. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Free of charge. Hoff-Barthelson Music School, 25 School Lane. 723-1169.

STAMFORD -- ''The Threepenny Opera'' presented by the Connecticut Grand Opera & Orchestra and the Stamford Center for the Arts in a new contemporary production. Tuesday through Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets are $25 to $67. Palace Theater, 61 Atlantic Street. (203) 325-4466.

WHITE PLAINS -- Ben Aronov Trio, featuring jazz standards from the pianist Ben Aronov's latest recording, ''The Best Thing for Me.'' Today at 2:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. 422-1480.

WHITE PLAINS -- Hoff-Barthelson Festival Orchestra and Chorus; Alexander Mickelthwate, director, featuring works by Copland, Britten, Orff and Weill. Also performances by Peter Press, guitarist; Jane Shelly, flutist; and Edmund Niemann, pianist. Tonight at 7. Tickets: $10; $9 for older people; $8 for Friends of Hoff-Barthelson. Community Unitarian Church, 468 Rosedale Avenue. 723-1169.

WHITE PLAINS -- Nancy Hambleton-Torrente, cellist, and Joy Plaisted, harpist, performing music by Haydn, Tournier, Arvo Part and Bartok. Wednesday at 12:35 p.m. Tickets: $5. Grace Episcopal Church, Main Street and Mamaroneck Avenue. 949-0384.
YONKERS -- Richard Slade, tenor, and Cynthia Reynolds, soprano, presenting ''O Love, True Love,'' Gilbert and Sullivan favorites. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Will Library, 1500 Central Park Ave. 337-1500.

YONKERS -- Joy Kelly presenting African and African-American songs and tales in a program for people 62 and older. Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1.50, including museum admission, coffee and cookies. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. 963-4550.
Art

BRONXVILLE -- Still life show, featuring works by Gitte Blass, Mary Napolitano, Hank Vergona and Melanie Whaley. Opening reception with refreshments, Friday 5 to 8 p.m. Through June 16. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. 337-4050.

DOBBS FERRY -- Life-size ceramic sculpture by Phyllis Kulmatiski and paintings by Leigh Li-Yun Wen. Opening reception today from 2 to 5:30 p.m. Through June 18. Main Street Gallery, 26 Main Street. 674-9171.
DOBBS FERRY -- ''Remainders/Reminders,'' recent works by Arline Simon and Lanny Lasky. Today only from 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26B Main Street. 674-8548.

IRVINGTON -- ''Colors of Nature,'' watercolors of flowers and landscapes by Linda Perlmutter and her students. Reception with refreshments, today from 2 to 5 p.m. Through June 15. River Gallery, 39 Main Street. 591-6208.

IRVINGTON -- ''Art of the Garden,'' featuring aluminum sculpture by Babette Bloch, watercolors and oil paintings by gallery artists and antique botanical prints. Through May. Janet Lippmann Fine Arts Gallery, 51 Main Street. 591-9240.

KATONAH -- ''Five Years,'' gallery retrospective featuring photography by Keith Carter, Walter Chappell, William Clift, Jed Devine, Harold Edgeton, Alfred Eisenstaedt and others. Through May 28. Candace Perich Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. 232-3966.

LARCHMONT -- ''Images,'' still lifes, landscapes and portraits by Julia Neumann. Reception next Saturday from 3 to 4:30 p.m. Also on view: ''Predestined,'' a mixed-media exhibition by Ricardo A. Garcia. Both through May 29. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. 834-2281.

LARCHMONT -- ''Landscapes,'' wall works in various media by gallery artists. Opens Wednesday. Reception with refreshments, next Saturday from 3 to 5 p.m. Through May 26. Mamaroneck Artists Guild, 2120 Boston Post Road. 834-1117.
PORT CHESTER -- Exhibition of ''Carved Spaces'' by Leslie Ferst. Opening reception today from 3 to 5 p.m. Through May 28. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. 937-2047.
RYE -- Silk paintings and watercolors by Annie Michel. Reception today from 3 to 5 p.m. Rye Free Reading Room, Village Green. 967-0480.
RYE -- Recent works by students, including paintings, watercolors, pastels and beaded jewelry. Through next Saturday. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. 967-0700.

VALHALLA -- ''Mainstream Studio Artists'' with paintings and mixed media by eight artists, including Annie Sylvester, Connie Fried, Rima Grad and Marion Schneider. Opening reception today from 4 to 6 p.m. Through June 7. Gallery at the Macy Pavilion of Westchester Medical Center. 493-8397.

YONKERS -- ''A Community Collects: The Bronxville Public Library,'' exhibition featuring 26 paintings from the library's collection. Closes today. Continuing exhibitions: ''Singular Voices/Voices of Many: Photographs From the Sixties by James Hinton,'' ''Dressing for a Victorian Day,'' the restored period rooms of Glenview Mansion and ''Birth and Death of a Star.'' Museum's hours: Wednesdays through Sundays from noon to 5 p.m. and Friday evenings until 9. Cost: $4; $3 for people 62 and older and children. Guided tours of Glenview Mansion, recommended for adults and children 10 and older. Saturdays and Sundays at 1 and 3 p.m. Cost: $7, including museum admission; $5 for people 62 and older and children. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. 963-4550.
Lectures
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''From the Silk Road: Artisans of Uzbekistan,'' discussed by Carter Malik. Today at 3:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library. 271-4755.
HARRISON -- Panel discussion on raising adolescents with serious mental, behavioral or substance-abuse problems. Thursday 7:30 p.m. Free. St. Vincent's conference center. 925-5138.
KATONAH -- Joys of birding, slide show by Donald and Lillian Stokes. Presented by Bedford Audubon Society. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $5. John Jay Homestead, 400 Route 22. 232-1999.

MAMARONECK -- Understanding religion and its role in society, by Mark Silk, director of the Center for the Study of Religion in Public Life at Trinity College in Connecticut. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $24; $15 for members. Emelin Theater. 698-0098.
MAMARONECK -- ''Power and Glory of St. Petersburg,'' by Mark Fichtel. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Mamaroneck Public Library, Library Lane. 698-1250.

MOUNT KISCO -- Poetry reading by Bertha Rogers. Followed by open mike. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $7; $5 for students and people 62 and older. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. 241-6922.
SHRUB OAK -- Nutritional medicine, discussed by Dr. Rima Laibow. Tomorrow 7 p.m. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. 245-5262.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Poetry readings by Margaret Holley and Marie Howe. Today at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $5, including refreshments; $3 for members. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. 332-5953.
VALHALLA -- Advice on ''Environmental Lawn Care'' by Joe Heller. Next Saturday from 11 a.m. to noon. Cornell Cooperative Extension, 26 Legion Drive. 946-3005.
WHITE PLAINS -- Harold Bloom talks about his latest book, ''How to Read and Why.'' Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library. 422-1480.

YONKERS -- Second of four lectures on ''Great American Trials'' by Leslie I. Levine, retired lawyer. Thursday 10:30 a.m. to noon. Registration, $5. Midchester Jewish Center, 236 Grandview Boulevard. 779-3660.

YONKERS -- ''Ghost Fleet,'' stories and pictures of ships that have sunk in New York Harbor, by Pete Eagleton and Nancy Brighton. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Beczak Environmental Education Center, 21 Alexander Street. 376-0859.
Films
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''The Thief,'' Russian film with subtitles. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Suggested donation: $2. New Rochelle Public Library. 632-7878.
PEEKSKILL -- ''Titus.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. 739-2333.
PURCHASE -- Harlan Jacobson's talk cinema, featuring an independent film and discussion. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Performing Arts Center, Purchase College. 251-6165.

VALHALLA -- Bernardo Bertolucci's latest film, ''Besieged.'' English and Italian, with subtitles. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $6; $5 for people 60 and older. Academic Arts Theater, Westchester Community College. 785-6700.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''Central Station,'' Portuguese film with subtitles. Tomorrow at 2 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library. 422-1480.
Children

KATONAH -- Siberian myth performance and mask-making workshop for children 4 and older, accompanied by an adult. Next Saturday from noon to 3 p.m. Tickets: $18 a child. Reservations. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. 232-9555.
MAMARONECK -- ''Jumping Frog of Calaveras County,'' Mark Twain story presented as a children's opera. Today at 2 and 4 p.m. Tickets: $18; $15 for members. Emelin Theater. 698-0098.
NORTH SALEM -- Children 6 through 12 create a stepping stone for Mother's Day. Next Saturday at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $8; $6 for members. Registration. Hammond Museum, Deveau Road. 669-5033.

OSSINING -- Mother's Day canoeing and picnic breakfast at Teatown Lake. Limit of three people (6 years and older) for each canoe. Participants must be swimmers. Next Sunday from 9 to 11 a.m. Tickets: $18 a canoe. Reservations. Meet at boat house of Teatown Lake Reservation. 962-2912.
PURCHASE -- Canada's Cirque Eloize, featuring acrobatics, music and humor. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $13 to $18. Performing Arts Center, Purchase College. 251-6200.

RYE -- ''Art for Mommy and Me,'' first of three-session program for mothers and children 24 to 36 months. Tomorrow from 10 to 10:45 p.m. Cost: $50; $45 for members. Registration. Rye Arts Center. 967-0700.
SOMERS -- ''Spring Fest,'' family event with music, demonstrations, pony rides and other children's activities. Today from noon to 4 p.m. Free admission. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. 232-7118.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''It's All Happening at the Zoo,'' children's concert featuring music about a pesky mosquito, a waltzing cat and other animals. Performed by Dorothy Happel, violinist; dancers of the Omega Liturgical Dance Company and Mace Perlman, a classically trained mime. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for people 62 and older; $8 for children. Grace Episcopal Church, Main Street at Mamaroneck Avenue. 949-0384.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Beauty and the Beast,'' children's show presented by Westco Productions. Thursday at 10:30 a.m., Friday at 10:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. and next Saturday at 11 a.m. Tickets: $10. Rochambeau School, 228 Fisher Avenue. 761-7463.
YONKERS -- The sky show ''Return to Mars'' for children 8 and older and adults. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Hudson River Museum. 963-4550.
Potpourri
ARDSLEY -- ''Superstar 2000,'' standard flower show. Presented by Ardsley Garden Club. Wednesday from 2 to 8 p.m. Free. St. Barnabas Episcopal Church, Revolutionary Rd.

ARDSLEY -- Learn-to-sail class. Sponsored by Inter-Village Continuing Education. Classroom sessions include sailing terms, aerodynamics and hydrodynamics of sailing and knowledge of launching and mooring. Wednesdays from 7 to 10 p.m. Through May. Ardsley Middle School. (Followed by hands-on experience at Kingsland Point Park. June 3 and 10 from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.) Must be able to swim and be 18 or older. Cost: $150. Registration. 693-6300, ext. 2283.

ARMONK -- Plant sale with garden advice, Mother's Day gifts and baked goods. Presented by Green Acres Garden Club. Next Saturday from 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free admission. H. C. Crittenden Middle School, McDonald Avenue. 273-9297.

CROSS RIVER -- ''Ethnicity and Family Therapy,'' workshop using film clips to illustrate ethnic differences in everyday patterns of eating, communicating and handling problems. Friday 9:30 to 11 a.m. Free. Registration. Four Winds, 800 Cross River Road. 763-8151.

GREENBURGH -- Birding program for beginners and families. Today at 10 a.m. Cost: $4, including admission to exhibits and live animal museum; $3 for students and people 62 and older; $2 for children. Plant sale. Next Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Demonstrations of indoor and outdoor composting, to recycle leaves, grass clippings and kitchen vegetable waste. Sponsored by the town of Greenburgh. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Rd. 723-3470.

KATONAH -- Spring fair and dog walk, with a dog massage class, dog agility play area, S.P.C.A. adoption center, tag sale, children's crafts, dog obedience demonstration, refreshments and more. Today from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Rain or shine. Admission: $5; dogs free. John Jay Homestead, 400 Route 22. 763-9012.

KATONAH -- Afternoon formal tea, followed by tour of house museum. Thursdays and Fridays at 1:30 p.m. Through October. Tickets: $22. ''Mothers and Others Celebration,'' featuring a three-course afternoon tea, recital and brief house tour. Next Friday and Saturday at 1 p.m. Tickets: $33; $26 for children 16 and younger. Reservations. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. 232-5035.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Learn to evaluate your child's personality and temperament and be an effective parent. Seminar led by Susan Roth Schneider. Tuesday from 8 to 9:30 p.m. Cost: $15; $12 for members. Jewish Community Center of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. 472-3300, ext. 339.

NORTH SALEM -- Book, bake and plant sale. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Free admission. Preview party, with first pick of books, champagne and desserts. Friday at 8 p.m. $10 donation. North Salem Free Library, 276 Titicus Road. 669-5161.

OSSINING -- Teatown plant sale with annuals, perennials, hanging baskets, herbs and vegetables. Next Saturday from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Free admission. Rain or shine. ''First Pick Sale.'' Friday from 4 to 7 p.m. $5 admission. Cedar Lane Park; follow signs from Route 134 exit of Taconic State Parkway. 762-2912, ext. 10.

RYE -- Tea party, featuring an elegant box lunch with tea, demonstration of tea preparation and discussion of specialty teas, by John Harney. Wednesday from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Tickets: $50. Reservations. Jay Heritage Center, 210 Boston Post Road. 698-9275.
ARTS & ENTERTAINMENT
